Dear Mrs. Girz:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 8/11/22.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed Home
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
Two of two borrowed files held documentation indicating orientation and policy
review was completed after the child was placed in the home.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-08 Case Service Plans Overview, Types, And Timeframes
Page 11
The supervisor must approve all case service plans within
14 days of the end of the report period.
One of fourteen service plans was not approved within the required timeframe. The
service plan completed on 1/2/22, was approved two days late on 1/18/22.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
8/3/2021 RENEWAL, CAP approved 8/24/21
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 If unable to obtain parent signatures on medical passports or parent/agency
treatment plans, the worker should indicate on the signature line the reason for
the missing signature and/or attempts to obtain the signature.
 PATP signatures are due within 30 days of the end of the report period. Not
within 30 days of report approval.
 Borrowed Bed agreements must not be effective until after the agency has
received the required documentation from the loaning agency.
4

V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The CAP, approved 8/24/21, was developed as a result of the 8/3/21 renewal
evaluation. The 8/3/21 review found two violations regarding service plan approval
and medical passports. During this review, one repeat violation was found regarding
timely service plan approval. Although there was a repeat violation, the rate of
occurrence decreased, as there was only one USP with a late approval date. Overall,
the agency’s CAP implementation regarding medical passports was successful, and
improvement was found regarding service plans.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed at the
agency visit on 8/11/22. The CAA reported successful CAP implementation over the
past year, stable staffing, financially stability, and high compliance in several areas as
tracked through key performance indicators with DHHS. The CAA reported no
disrupted placements or unplanned moves. Overall, the Chief Administrator reported
intakes have been slower, but the agency is stable and functioning well.
Interviews
Two staff interviews were completed on-site. Staff reported the agency has a positive
environment, where they work well together. Caseloads are busy, but manageable.
The supervisor is helpful, knowledgeable, and supportive. The Chief Administrator is
approachable and helpful with anything staff need. The staff did not have any
concerns or suggestions for improvement at the agency.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes, and rules, MISEP requirements, and contract/policy. Upon receipt
of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on
a regular license.
